result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:16 PM Defendant Long Vang in court, in custody from the DCJ.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Long Vang.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

21CF313, 21CF337, 21CM80, 21CM165, 21TR4461, 21TR4462, 21TR4463, 21TR4464, 21TR4465, 22CF31

Interpreter Pa Lee appears by Zoom, is sworn in and interprets

Court - notes all current cash bond amounts and what cash has been posted
Atty Lundeen - makes argument for bond modification of sign bonds or less than $1000 cash
  - 22CF31 - currently $1000 cash, asking for high sigh or minimal cash
  - 21CF337 - currently $1000 cash w/ $500 posted, asking for $500 cash
  - 21CF313 - currently $4000 cash w/ $2000 posted, asking for $2000 cash
Court - speaks to fax rec'd from deft
State - opposes any modification of bonds, makes argument and speaks to missed appearances - asks to schedule trial
Court - makes statement, motion is denied - will not modify bonds today - speaks to scheduling jury trial
State - asks to schedule 22CF31 for trial
Atty Lundeen - no objection
Court - schedules JT in 22CF31 for June 12 & 13, FPT 5/26 @ 9:30-10:30, Parties to file motions in limine, jury instructions, and witness list by 5/12 - other acts to be filed by 1/23, response by 2/24, and reply by 3/3 - motion hearing scheduled for 4/3 at 9:45 for 30 min - schedules STC on all Br 3 cases for 1/19 at 2:00 and schedules STC on all Br 1 cases for 12/20 at 4:00
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

11:10 AM Defendant Long Vang in court, in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Long Vang.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Pa Lee appears via Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk

records.addlTxt:
03:15 PM Defendant, Long Vang in person from the Dunn County jail with Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared via Zoom. Interpreter Pa Lee appears in person. Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly.  B. Bahr - Clerk
21CF313, 21TR4461, 21TR4462, 21TR4463, 21TR4464, 21TR4465, (21TR5857, 21TR5858  Br2 cases) (21CF337, 22CF31  Br3 cases)
03:16 PM - interpreter is sworn in.

21TR5857, 21TR5858 - INIT
Defendant - has rcvd citations. Enters NG plea. 
Court - goes over jury rights. Send notice of DA Pre trial conference to DE at the Dunn Co jail.

21CF313, 21CF337 - Prelim
State - rcvd notice from Atty Lundeen that DE will waive prelim on both matters.
Court - goes over right to prelim with DE. 
DE - would like to waive the preliminary hearing in 21CF313 and 21CF337.
Court - provides colloquy. Finds DE knowingly and voluntarily waived preliminary hearing.
Atty Lundeen - prepared to handle the ARGN today. Has rcvd Information.
Court - will print Information for DE.
DE - waives reading of Information. Enters plea of NG on all counts.
Court - accepts NG plea. 
Atty Lundeen - asks for rtrn date on both cases. 
Court - sets rtrn date in Br1 for 21CF313 and 21CF337. 21TR4461, 21TR4462, 21TR4463, 21TR4464, 21TR4465 to tag along.

22CF31 - INIT
State - requests $1,000 cash bond and No contact with location N4946 County Rd J, Menomonie, WI 54751.
Atty Lundeen - argues for sign bond. No objection to no contact provisions.
Court - orders $1,000 cash bond and No contact with location N4946 County Rd J, Menomonie, WI 54751.
DE - makes statement regarding missed appearances.
Court - reads bond conditions to DE due to language and reading concerns.
Atty Lundeen - rcvd Compaint. Waives reading enters NG plea. Waives timelimits for prelim. Asks for same rtrn date as other cases in Br1. 
Court - sets return date in Br 1 on April 4th 2022 at 11:30 AM

Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
